name: Baked Chicken Empanadas
author: Yoly
summary: These are quick and easy to make. And for an easier prep, I used diced rotisserie chicken and jarred salsa.
ingredients: 12  empanada pastry discs (such as Goya® Tapas para Empanadas)
½ (8 ounce) package Neufchatel cheese, softened
¼ cup medium salsa (such as Pace®)
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Combine chicken, Neufchatel cheese, and salsa in a saucepan over medium heat until cheese melts, 3 to 5 minutes
Season with salt and stir until well combined
Lay out empanada discs and place 1 tablespoons of chicken filling onto each disc
Fold dough over filling to close
Wet fingers with water and run them along the edges to help seal
Press edges together using the tines of a fork
Place empanadas on the prepared baking sheet and brush with heavy whipping cream
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes
